alert.note: Alert for Gilchrist; Suwannee; Western Alachua (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 23 at 4:48PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Gilchrist, southwestern Alachua and central Suwannee Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 447 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a broken line extending from near Mcalpin to near Archer. Movement was west at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph and minor flooding due to heavy rainfall. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor flooding due to heavy rainfall is possible. Locations impacted include... Trenton, Bell, Ichetucknee Spring, Archer, Wellborn, Obrien, Mcalpin, Luraville, Newberry and Branford. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
